definitions: The practice of accumulating a large amount of digital content, such as articles, videos, or files, often beyond what can be reasonably consumed or utilized.
The act of saving or bookmarking numerous pieces of online information with the intention of reviewing them later, but frequently resulting in an unmanageable backlog.
examples: Her content hoarding led to thousands of unread articles.
He was guilty of content hoarding, with gigabytes of downloaded movies.
Many users engage in content hoarding, creating vast digital libraries.
